Name: Manage University Operations
Documentation: Encompasses all core activities required to operate a research-intensive university, from academic delivery and research to commercialization and engagement.

Name: Manage Academic Offerings
Documentation: Concerns the design, governance, and quality assurance of all academic programs and their associated standards and policies.

Name: Manage Student Lifecycle
Documentation: Covers the end-to-end process of attracting, admitting, educating, assessing, and credentialing students.

Name: Manage Research Lifecycle
Documentation: Encompasses the entire lifecycle of scholarly research, from identifying opportunities and securing funding to execution, analysis, and dissemination.

Name: Manage Commercialization & Partnerships
Documentation: Focuses on translating research into commercial value and managing strategic relationships with industry and external partners.

Name: Manage University Engagement
Documentation: Involves building and maintaining relationships with key external stakeholders, including alumni, funders, partners, and the wider community.

Name: Manage University Resources
Documentation: Concerns the management and allocation of core academic and research resources, including faculty, facilities, and learning environments.

Name: Design Academic Programs
Documentation: The capability to create, review, and update curricula and degree programs to meet academic standards and market needs.

Name: Manage Academic Standards
Documentation: The capability to define and enforce policies and standards for academic quality and integrity across the university.

Name: Manage Assessment Policies
Documentation: The capability to establish and govern the rules and methods for evaluating student performance and learning outcomes.

Name: Recruit Prospective Students
Documentation: The capability to attract and engage potential students for the university's academic programs.

Name: Evaluate Student Applications
Documentation: The capability to assess and process applications from prospective students against defined admissions criteria.

Name: Deliver Academic Instruction
Documentation: The capability to provide teaching and learning experiences to students through lectures, seminars, labs, and other modalities.

Name: Assess Student Work
Documentation: The capability to evaluate student submissions, such as exams and assignments, against academic criteria.

Name: Administer Academic Credentials
Documentation: The capability to formally issue degrees, diplomas, and other qualifications to students who have met program requirements.

Name: Manage Admissions Criteria
Documentation: The capability to define, maintain, and apply the criteria used for selecting and admitting students.

Name: Manage Student Records
Documentation: The capability to maintain accurate and secure records of student academic progress, enrollment, and personal information.

Name: Identify Funding Opportunities
Documentation: The capability to discover and evaluate potential sources of funding for foundational research from grants and other sources.

Name: Develop Grant Proposals
Documentation: The capability to prepare and submit compelling applications for research funding to granting agencies.

Name: Conduct Scholarly Investigations
Documentation: The capability to execute systematic research and experiments to generate new knowledge and insights.

Name: Analyze Experimental Data
Documentation: The capability to process, interpret, and draw conclusions from data collected during research activities.

Name: Publish Research Papers
Documentation: The capability to prepare, submit, and manage the publication of research findings in scholarly journals and conferences.

Name: Manage Research Data
Documentation: The capability to collect, store, secure, and provide access to research data in accordance with ethical and funder requirements.

Name: Manage Research Ethics
Documentation: The capability to ensure that all research activities comply with established ethical principles and regulatory standards.

Name: Develop Industry Partnerships
Documentation: The capability to identify, establish, and cultivate strategic relationships with commercial and governmental organizations.

Name: Define Research Solutions
Documentation: The capability to understand partner needs and design bespoke research projects or consulting services to address them.

Name: Negotiate Commercial Agreements
Documentation: The capability to formulate, negotiate, and finalize contracts and agreements for commissioned research and services.

Name: Deliver Contractual Research
Documentation: The capability to execute research projects according to the terms, timelines, and deliverables specified in a commercial agreement.

Name: Report Project Deliverables
Documentation: The capability to formally document and present research outcomes and deliverables to external partners.

Name: Manage Contract Billing
Documentation: The capability to issue invoices and process payments for commissioned research and consulting services.

Name: Support Commercial Partners
Documentation: The capability to provide ongoing support and relationship management to commercial partners after project completion.

Name: Manage Intellectual Properties
Documentation: The capability to identify, protect, and manage the university's intellectual property assets, such as patents and copyrights.

Name: Manage Technology Transfers
Documentation: The capability to facilitate the licensing and transfer of university-owned intellectual property to external entities for commercialization.

Name: Engage University Alumni
Documentation: The capability to maintain relationships with and provide services to the university's graduate community.

Name: Manage Marketing Campaigns
Documentation: The capability to design and execute marketing and communication campaigns to promote the university's brand and offerings.

Name: Manage External Relations
Documentation: The capability to manage relationships with a broad range of external stakeholders, including donors and community partners.

Name: Manage Funder Relations
Documentation: The capability to build and maintain relationships with government agencies, foundations, and other entities that provide research funding.

Name: Manage Publication Venues
Documentation: The capability to identify and manage relationships with academic publishers and conference organizers.

Name: Manage Faculty Resources
Documentation: The capability to recruit, develop, and assign academic staff to teaching and research activities.

Name: Manage Learning Environments
Documentation: The capability to provide and maintain physical and digital spaces, such as classrooms and online platforms, for teaching and learning.

Name: Manage Research Facilities
Documentation: The capability to operate and maintain specialized laboratories, equipment, and other facilities required for research.

Name: Educate Students
Documentation: Delivers structured degree programs that equip students with advanced knowledge and accredited qualifications for their future careers.

Name: Conduct Foundational Research
Documentation: Generates and disseminates new fundamental knowledge and insights that advance scientific understanding and the public good.

Name: Deliver Commissioned Research
Documentation: Delivers bespoke research projects and expert consulting services to solve specific problems for external partners on a contractual basis.

Name: Develop Program
Documentation: The stage of defining and structuring the academic offering before student engagement.

Name: Enroll & Teach Students
Documentation: The core stages of the student journey, from recruitment and admission through to instruction and graduation.

Name: Maintain Alumni Relations
Documentation: The post-graduation stage focused on supporting and engaging with the alumni community.

Name: Define Curricula
Documentation: The value stream stage where academic programs and courses are designed and approved.

Name: Recruit Students
Documentation: The value stream stage focused on marketing programs and attracting a pool of qualified applicants.

Name: Admit Applicants
Documentation: The value stream stage where student applications are evaluated and offers of admission are made.

Name: Deliver Courses
Documentation: The value stream stage where instruction is delivered to enrolled students.

Name: Assess Student Performance
Documentation: The value stream stage where student learning is evaluated through exams, papers, and other assessments.

Name: Confer Degrees
Documentation: The value stream stage where successful students are formally awarded their academic qualifications.

Name: Support Alumni
Documentation: The value stream stage focused on providing services and engagement opportunities to graduates.

Name: Plan & Execute Research
Documentation: The core stages of the research lifecycle, from identifying opportunities and securing funding to execution and dissemination.

Name: Commercialize Discoveries
Documentation: The stage focused on managing the intellectual property resulting from foundational research.

Name: Identify Research Opportunities
Documentation: The value stream stage where potential areas for new research and associated funding sources are identified.

Name: Secure Research Funding
Documentation: The value stream stage where grant proposals are written and submitted to secure financial support for research.

Name: Execute Research Plans
Documentation: The value stream stage where the planned research activities and experiments are carried out.

Name: Analyze Research Data
Documentation: The value stream stage where data collected from research is processed and interpreted.

Name: Disseminate Research Findings
Documentation: The value stream stage where research results are published in academic journals or presented at conferences.

Name: Manage Research IP
Documentation: The value stream stage where intellectual property arising from research is identified, protected, and managed.

Name: Acquire & Deliver Partner Projects
Documentation: The end-to-end process of engaging partners, defining and negotiating projects, and delivering the contracted outcomes.

Name: Engage Potential Partners
Documentation: The value stream stage focused on building relationships with potential industry or government clients.

Name: Scope Research Projects
Documentation: The value stream stage where the partner's needs are analyzed and a potential research solution is defined.

Name: Negotiate Research Contracts
Documentation: The value stream stage where the terms, deliverables, and costs of the research project are formally agreed upon.

Name: Execute Contracted Research
Documentation: The value stream stage where the agreed-upon research activities are performed for the partner.

Name: Deliver Research Outcomes
Documentation: The value stream stage where the final findings and deliverables are formally presented to the partner.

Name: Process Contract Payments
Documentation: The value stream stage where invoices are sent and payment is collected from the partner.

Name: Provide Post-Project Support
Documentation: The value stream stage for providing follow-up support or services after the main project is complete.

Name: University Operation
Documentation: Represents the entirety of the university's core operational entities, including its academic offerings, students, research, and resources.

Name: Academic Offering
Documentation: A conceptual grouping of business objects related to the university's educational products and their governance.

Name: Student
Documentation: A conceptual grouping of business objects related to an individual's journey through the university, from applicant to graduate.

Name: Research Endeavor
Documentation: A conceptual grouping of business objects related to the creation and management of scholarly research.

Name: Commercialization
Documentation: A conceptual grouping of business objects related to the university's commercial activities, partnerships, and intellectual property.

Name: University Engagement
Documentation: A conceptual grouping of business objects related to the university's relationships with its external stakeholders.

Name: University Resource
Documentation: A conceptual grouping of business objects representing the core assets, such as people and facilities, that enable university operations.

Name: Academic Program
Documentation: A structured course of study leading to an academic qualification, such as a degree or diploma.

Name: Academic Standard
Documentation: A defined rule or benchmark for quality and performance in academic matters.

Name: Assessment Policy
Documentation: A formal policy governing how student performance is to be evaluated.

Name: Prospective Student
Documentation: An individual who has expressed interest in or is being targeted for admission to the university.

Name: Student Application
Documentation: A formal request submitted by a prospective student for admission to an academic program.

Name: Course Offering
Documentation: A specific instance of a course being taught in a particular semester or term.

Name: Student Assessment
Documentation: An evaluation of a student's work, such as an exam, essay, or project.

Name: Academic Credential
Documentation: A formal qualification, such as a degree or certificate, awarded to a student upon successful completion of a program.

Name: Admissions Criterion
Documentation: A specific requirement or standard used to evaluate student applications for admission.

Name: Student Record
Documentation: The official, consolidated record of a student's academic history and status at the university.

Name: Funding Opportunity
Documentation: A specific grant, award, or call for proposals to which researchers can apply for funding.

Name: Grant Proposal
Documentation: A formal document submitted to a funding body to request financial support for a research project.

Name: Scholarly Investigation
Documentation: A specific research project or experiment undertaken to answer a research question.

Name: Experimental Datum
Documentation: A single piece or set of raw data generated and collected during a research investigation.

Name: Research Publication
Documentation: A scholarly article, paper, or book that disseminates the findings of a research project.

Name: Research Dataset
Documentation: A curated collection of data produced or used in a research project.

Name: Research Ethic
Documentation: A principle or standard governing the responsible conduct of research.

Name: Industry Partnership
Documentation: A formal collaborative relationship between the university and a commercial or government entity.

Name: Research Solution
Documentation: A defined scope of work or project plan designed to address a partner's specific problem or need.

Name: Commercial Agreement
Documentation: A legally binding contract that outlines the terms of a commissioned research project or service.

Name: Contractual Research
Documentation: A specific research project being executed under the terms of a commercial agreement.

Name: Project Deliverable
Documentation: A tangible or intangible output, such as a report or prototype, that must be provided to a partner as part of a contract.

Name: Contract Invoice
Documentation: A formal request for payment for services rendered or milestones achieved in a commercial project.

Name: Commercial Partner
Documentation: An external organization (e.g., a company, government agency) that contracts with the university for research or consulting services.

Name: Intellectual Property
Documentation: A work or invention that is the result of creativity, such as a manuscript or a design, to which one has rights and for which one may apply for a patent, copyright, trademark, etc.

Name: Technology Transfer
Documentation: The process and agreement for transferring a specific piece of intellectual property to an external party.

Name: Alumnus
Documentation: A graduate or former student of the university.

Name: Marketing Campaign
Documentation: A coordinated series of steps intended to promote the university or its specific programs.

Name: External Relationship
Documentation: A formal or informal connection with an external stakeholder, such as a donor or community group.

Name: Funder Relationship
Documentation: A relationship with an organization that provides grants or other forms of research funding.

Name: Publication Venue
Documentation: A specific journal, conference proceeding, or publisher through which research is disseminated.

Name: Faculty Member
Documentation: An academic staff member of the university responsible for teaching and/or research.

Name: Learning Environment
Documentation: A physical or virtual setting in which teaching and learning occur, such as a lecture hall or an online learning system.

Name: Research Facility
Documentation: A specialized space, such as a laboratory or clean room, equipped for conducting research.
